```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(targets)
library(knitr)

# Load targets
tar_load(combined_data)
tar_load(combined_data_wide)
```

::: {.panel-tabset}

### Plot

```{r plot, echo=FALSE, fig.width=10, fig.height=6}
ggplot(combined_data, aes(x = date, y = unemployment_rate, color = source)) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1) +
  labs(
    title = "Chicago Fed Flow-Consistent Unemployment Rate vs BLS Unemployment Rate",
    x = "Date",
    y = "Unemployment Rate (%)",
    color = "Source"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "bottom",
    plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold")
  ) + 
  labs(
    title = "Chicago Fed's flow-consistent unemployment rate tracks the official rate",
    subtitle = "Monthly unemployment rates",
  )
```

### Data Table

Download the data: [data.csv](data.csv)

```{r table, echo=FALSE}
combined_data_wide %>%
  mutate(Date = format(Date, "%Y-%m-%d")) %>%
  kable(
    col.names = c("Date", "BLS Unemployment Rate (%)", "Chicago Fed FCR (%)"),
    align = c("l", "r", "r")
  )
```

:::

Source: [Chicago Federal Reserve](https://www.chicagofed.org/research/data/chicago-fed-labor-market-indicators/latest-release) and [Bureau of Labor Statistics](https://www.bls.gov/cps/)
